required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Atrial Fibrillation in Cryptogenic Stroke With Patent Foramen Ovale Closure (PFO-AF) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Atrial Fibrillation in Cryptogenic Stroke With Patent Foramen Ovale Closure (PFO-AF) Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the incidence of atrial fibrillation (AF), documented using data recorded by an implantable Holter monitoring device (Reveal Linq, Medtronic) within 2 years after percutaneous closure of patent foramen ovale for cryptogenic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to assess the incidence of atrial fibrillation (AF), documented using data recorded by an implantable Holter monitoring device (Reveal Linq, Medtronic) within 2 years after percutaneous closure of patent foramen ovale (PFO) for cryptogenic stroke. Secondary objectives include assessment of the burden of AF at 2, 12 and 24 months after PFO closure; evaluation of the relationship between plasma levels of MR proANP and presence of AF within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure in patients with a history of cryptogenic ischemic stroke; and description of recurrence rates for stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic), major bleeding, minor bleeding, peripheral emboli during the 2-year follow-up period after percutaneous PFO closure, in patients with and without AF.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 months after percutaneous PFO closure
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of documented atrial fibrillation (i.e. at least one episode lasting 30 seconds)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative total time in atrial fibrillation (in days, hours, minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Relation between MR proANP levels and atrial fibrillation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure
secondary_outcome.description: Relation between pre-procedure circulating venous MR proANP levels and atrial fibrillation defined as per the primary endpoint

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure
secondary_outcome.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke documented by CT or MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral emboli by CT or MRI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 years after percutaneous PFO closure
secondary_outcome.description: Major or minor bleeding according to the ISTH classification

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients planned for percutaneous PFO closure
arm_group.description: Patients will undergo implantation of a Holter device (Reveal Linq Medtronic) 2 months prior to percutaneous PFO closure. Devices will be monitored by telemonitoring until the PFO closure procedure, and at 2, 12 and 24 months after the procedure.

intervention.description: Implantation of a Holter device (Reveal Linq, Medtronic) for telemonitoring of cardiac rhythm
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients planned for percutaneous PFO closure

intervention.description: Patients will undergo percutaneous closure of patent foramen ovale
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients planned for percutaneous PFO closure

study_pop.textblock: Prospective patients who have had cryptogenic stroke (ischemic only) and with patent foramen ovale confirmed by transoesophageal echocardiography, with an indication for percutaneous closure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (aged >18 years)
- with an indication for percutaneous closure of PFO due to cryptogenic stroke, with indication validated by a cardio-neurological team.
- patients must provide written informed consent
- patients must be affiliated to a social security regime or be a beneficiary thereof.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under legal protection
- Patients not affiliated to any social security regime
- Patients within the exclusion period of another clinical trial as per the national registry of research volunteers
